Decaf Editor API

Uses of Package
com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar

Packages that use com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar
com.bitwise.decaf.editor This package contains the foundation of the Decaf editor, including all user interface components for code constructs up to but excluding the contents of method bodies (those are found in the grammar package). 
com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar This package contains the user interface foundation for the contents of method bodies. 
 

Classes in com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar used by com.bitwise.decaf.editor
Grammar.ClassReference
           
 

Classes in com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar used by com.bitwise.decaf.editor.grammar
CodeNode
          CodeNode is the abstract base class for all nodes in the code tree under the DMethod.BodyGrammar.
CodeNode.Event
          The class of event object fired by this class.
CodeNode.Listener
          Radio frequency for CodeNode communications.
EnforcementOfficer
          Realtime code validation is performed by subclasses of the EnforcementOfficer class, each of which patrols a single Grammar instance for compliance with a particular rule or set of rules (typically from the JLS.
EnforcementOfficer.ViolationWindow
          Displays the violation declared by an EnforcementOfficer
Grammar
          Grammar is a secondary base class of CodeNode, representing both Phrase and Sentence.
Grammar.Content
           
GrammarMenu
           
MaskEditor
           
Officer
          Derivations of the Officer class patrol instances of Grammar, which uses the method Officer.call() to set this officer to task.
Officer.Foreign
          This empty interface denotes an officer that patrols one Grammar at the behest of another; typically such officers are delegates, such as the Deputy class.
Paragraph
           
Phrase
          Phrase is a transparent wrapper for a GExpression, holding its place in the code tree and providing a generic interface by which the editor can interact with it.
Sentence
          Sentence is a transparent wrapper for GStatement, holding its place in the code tree and providing a generic interface by which the editor can interact with it.
